intro: Nototriche ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a compact inflorescence. Nototriche ovata is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
